title: Silchar
summary: Silchar is the headquarters of the Cachar district of the state of Assam, India. This City is 343 kilometres (213 mi) south east of Guwahati. It was founded by Captain Thomas Fisher in 1832 when he shifted the headquarters of Cachar to Janiganj in Silchar.[1] It earned the moniker “Island of Peace” from Indira Gandhi, the then Prime Minister of India.[2] Silchar is the site of the world's first polo club and the first competitive polo match.[3][4] In 1985, an Air India flight from Kolkata to Silchar became the world's first all-women crew flight.[5] Silchar was a tea town and Cachar club was the meeting point for tea planters. This valley town is extremely rich in terms of culture and heritage.
